page.title: 19Annual event at Creca
page.content: Riding of the Marches takes place annually. It is traditional for the Cornet, Cornet's Lass, Standard Bearer and a following of 20 to 30 riders to ride round the Borough Boundaries of Annan and report back to the Provest that all is well. The Belted Stone on Creca Moss is one of the Boundary markers and Creca is a refreshment point where the riders dismount and partake of drinks. The Cornet and his followers then proceed out of the village and leave the area at Creca Hall. This event takes place in July and is a ride of some 15 miles. It is every young riders' ambition to take part in this event and ride-outs are held for two to three months beforehand so that riders and horses may get fit.
